newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 23.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Aug 23.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Friday morning.
NEWS OUTLOOK:
** India's oil imports seen rising to $13 billion by 2000/01 (April-March) against $7.5 billion in 1995/96, the central bank governor says
Direct foreign and portfolio investments seen at $7.5
billion in 1996/97 against $4.5 billion a year-ago
Foreign currency reserves should not fall below $17
billion in 1996/97 and current account deficit should stay at around 2.0 percent of gross domestic product, the governor told business leaders in Delhi on Thursday
** Securities and Exchange Board of India is considering plan to ban short sales in falling market, the Business Standard reports
** Government eases controls on imports
** India clears 69 foreign investments worth 11.31 billion rupees
** The spot dollar/rupee opened steady at 35.65/67 per dollar and seen quiet, dealers say
MARKETS:
** Indian stock markets closed mixed on Thursday in light volume with a local holiday for institutions and banks in Bombay affecting activity, and traders expect the market to perk up on Friday
** The 30-share Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) index fell 17.42 points, or 0.51 percent, to 3,388.80
** The 100-share National index eased 1.06 points, or 0.07 percent, to 1,550.20
** The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index ended 3.0 points higher at 1,002
** The 500-share CRISIL slipped 0.02 points to 680.25
** The Delhi share index fell 3.71 points to 792.03
** The Calcutta index 8.83 points to 450.36
** The Madras index rose 8.44 points to 3,578.88
** The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index rose 0.59 points, or 0.82 percent, to 72.84 with the premium over the local market at 12.09 percent compared with Wednesday's 10.86 percent
